title: Frontend Engineer Interview Guide
description: Master JavaScript, React, and UI/UX engineering interviews.

content.text: Frontend interviews focus on JavaScript proficiency, framework knowledge, and building performant, accessible user interfaces. Expect coding challenges, system design for UI, and discussions about web fundamentals.

**What interviewers assess:**

- JavaScript/TypeScript fundamentals
- Framework expertise (React, Vue, Angular)
- CSS and responsive design
- Performance optimization
- Accessibility and web standards

**Typical frontend interview loop:**

1. **Recruiter screen** (30 min)
2. **Technical phone screen** (45-60 min) - JavaScript/DOM coding
3. **Onsite/Virtual loop** (4-5 hours):
   - JavaScript deep-dive round
   - UI coding challenge (build a component)
   - Frontend system design
   - Behavioral round
Practice building components from scratch without relying on libraries. Interviewers want to see you understand the fundamentals, not just framework APIs.

items.text: Performance (lazy loading, code splitting, Core Web Vitals)

Build components without frameworks to understand fundamentals

Prepare to discuss past UI projects and trade-offs
